FMB1.flavor: Persecuted alchemists fled deep into Kessig's wilds, seeking solitude to continue their ghoulish craft.
FMB1.name: Alchemist's Refuge
FMB1.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{G}{U}, {T}: You may cast spells this turn as though they had flash.

FMB1.text:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.

FMB1.flavor: "After years of study, I've learned an important lesson: the relics we watch may be watching us back." —Anowon, the Ruin Sage
FMB1.name: Amulet of Vigor
FMB1.text: Whenever a permanent enters the battlefield tapped and under your control, untap it.

FMB1.flavor: Despite its fearsome stature, it is as elusive as a shadow, circling round to stalk those who presume to hunt it.
FMB1.name: Archetype of Endurance
FMB1.text:
Creatures you control have hexproof.
Creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and can't have or gain hexproof.

FMB1.name: Aurelia's Fury
FMB1.text: Aurelia's Fury deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets. Tap each creature dealt damage this way. Players dealt damage this way can't cast noncreature spells this turn.

FMB1.flavor: "Let your heartbeat be the thunder in the valley. Let your swords be the lightning on the peaks." —Lothar Lovisason, Balduvian chieftain
FMB1.name: Balduvian Rage
FMB1.text:
Target attacking creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

FMB1.text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

FMB1.name: Blasting Station
FMB1.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Blasting Station deals 1 damage to any target.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may untap Blasting Station.

FMB1.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Blighted Agent can't be blocked.

FMB1.flavor: Some creatures are bound to the cold by Rimewind magic. Others seek it out, adapted by two thousand years of the Ice. The Boreal, where Heidar's frigid sway is strongest, is home to both.
FMB1.name: Boreal Druid
FMB1.text: {T}: Add {C}.

FMB1.flavor: "Planeswalking cannot be taught. Either you see the doors or you do not." —Nissa Revane
FMB1.name: Boundless Realms
FMB1.text: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of lands you control, and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

FMB1.flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

FMB1.text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.

Lands you control are Plains.
Nonland permanents you control are white. The same is true for spells you control and nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.
You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's converted mana cost.

Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Champion a creature (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

FMB1.text:
Flying

FMB1.text: Will of the council — When Council Guardian enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for blue, black, red, or green. Council Guardian gains protection from each color with the most votes or tied for most votes.

FMB1.name: Delay
FMB1.text: Counter target spell. If the spell is countered this way, exile it with three time counters on it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. If it doesn't have suspend, it gains suspend. (At the beginning of its owner's upkeep, remove a time counter from that card. When the last is removed, the player plays it without paying its mana cost. If it's a creature, it has haste.)

FMB1.text:
Flying

FMB1.flavor: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.

FMB1.flavor: It is the soul of a philosopher who died of starvation contemplating the universe.
FMB1.name: Eidolon of Rhetoric
FMB1.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

FMB1.flavor: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.
FMB1.name: Fatespinner
FMB1.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.

FMB1.name: Fiery Gambit
FMB1.text: Flip a coin until you lose a flip or choose to stop flipping. If you lose a flip, Fiery Gambit has no effect. If you win one or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to target creature. If you win two or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 6 damage to each opponent. If you win three or more flips, draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.

FMB1.name: Flamekin Harbinger
FMB1.text: When Flamekin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elemental card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5.

FMB1.name: Zur's Weirding
FMB1.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
